creator: rh@harrogatesoftware.com
text:
Hi.

Found a problem generating page references with FOP 0.20.5.  An error always 
occurs on the very first id attribute, and is not actually repeated in the .fo 
source (i checked manually).  I have generated a small demo file (.fo)for 
debugging purposes, and this is located at:

http://www.specialistinfo.com/FOP/fop-bug.fo

I ran the command:
"c:\foobar\fop fop-bug.fo fop-bug.pdf" 

and it spat out the error:
[ERROR] file:/C:/fop/fop-0.20.5/fop-bug.fo:21:427 The id "azizacce01" already 
exists in this document

I also double checked running the same .fo file through another xsl-fo -> pdf 
generator (called xml2pdf, from alien tools i think), and this worked fine, 
putting in the links and everything.  (ps. xml2pdf sux!!! - It's really slow 
and doesn't format things properly - Pleeeeease fix fop quick!!!!)

Hope this helps you out.

Robin
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 3497 ***
creator: j3322ptm@yahoo.de
gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
